column4: Is there a way that I can just forget all the XGL stuff and revert back to a working X for my Nvidia card?
I ahve it running at the moment but when I go into stuff the like penguin racer, it is IMPOSSIBLY slow and laggy
Ti4200 128MB I think
I think my xserver is working OK, It's just very laggy for some reason, it used to be like this on the LiveCD, any ideas, anyone? Help would be greatly appreciated.
sTILL AN INVALID OP.
I'll remove XGL through Synaptic and see what that does.
#ubuntu-xgl wasn't any help i'm 'fraid. it was dead room.
I am actually using xserver now
But when i restart, x fails to load, and then the terminal gives me some lip about not being able to load. and then I have to redo the config x thing all over again
Is there a way of configuring refresh rate in x?
In /etc/X11/xorg.conf
Well, first things first...BACK UP YOUR XORG.CONF!
Did you make a backup?
If I was that smart to make a backup in the first place, I wouldnt be here :p
Heh. Alright. I doubt it's a framerate problem, but, lets see something
Can you run glxgears, and give me a framerate?
Should echo to the console every 5 seconds...
: nope, just a picture of the gears moving VERY choppy
Your best bet would be to try the forums now
Hrm...Could even be correct...
Like I said, post to the forum. Give as much detail as you can (xorg.conf, that framerate, full story, etc.), and hopefuly, someone that knowsmore than I will stumble upon it...
